website_summaries.verdict: Compact design gives those with small storage needs the ability to store the unit anywhere.
pros: This NAS system delivers a better than average level of speed and performance
Will handle HD video files nicely, delivering high quality playback
Uses QuickConnect so you can access your files over any internet connection
cons: Uses a dual-core CPU, so it's not for extremely busy environments

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My NAS died after 2 months of flawless operation. It just quit working. I have been trying to RMA the NAS, but Synology will not reply to my support requests. It had been over a week since I submitted an RMA. Be weary of their support if your device fails.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to set up and use, zero customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Massively complicated to set up with almost no help from the available help files. Confusing as it could possibly be. This is NOT for beginners or the casual user. Struggling for hours I have yet to be able to share anything on my home network. Edited to take away a star. There is no support - none. Can't even get a basic question answered and there is no reasonable way to contact Synology support . You are on your own here.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be used worldwide without buying VPN
customer_reviews.text: Does everyone know that you cannot connect to it in other countries, such as China if you don’t have VPN? All Synology devices cannot do it. They just won’t let you know before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Na LV

customer_reviews.title: Synology Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: 4/4/19: called Amazon to inform them that I the Synology tech that I spoke to today on 4/4/19 was incapable of communicating properly regarding the random 'powering off' of my DS218+ NAS box. He stated (quote) "We are not affiliated with Amazon". The tone of this comment was one of negativity, and was NOT appreciated by me as an Amazon customer. The conversation then became adversarial and went downhill after this comment by the Synology tech. This was NOT a positive statement that any Synology rep should be making about Amazon who is selling/marketing their product. I will NEVER buy another Synology product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: but am enjoying great plex encoding times
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this a couple of weeks but I am impressed. I came from a 3 year old DS1512, which I will move off site and use as a backup. Initially, I upgraded to a new DS1517+, but saw no increase in CPU speed. I returned the DS1517+ and "downgraded" to this 918+, gave up a bay, but am enjoying great plex encoding times. I just got 2 of these inexpensive 8GB Ram modules to work  The DS918+ now recognizes the full 16GB. Time for some VMM experimentation. I remain a big Synology fan.
customer_reviews.author: Different Drummer

customer_reviews.title: Hard drives not included, but works great with PLEX media server application.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly fine as a media server running Plex and home network storage. My only complaint is that I misunderstood and thought it included at list one hard drive. It does not. It has 2 bays, so after dropping $300 thinking I had what I needed to set up my home storage and media server, I had to drop another $200 for duel hard drives. All in $500, but so far works as I hoped. In the process of loading all my media and can now watch movies on all my smart TVs and devices and listen to music on all devices as well, streaming on home network. Overall happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gcheezpuff

customer_reviews.title: Much faster
customer_reviews.text: I moved from Synology 212J to 218+. Big leap. I found it much faster than 212J, of course, I have added SSD drives for 218+. DS Audio works flawlessly with Alexa. And Plex is more convenient to view photos and videos on Samsung TV rather than using DS Photo+ thru TV browser. I am very happy with the purchase and would definitely recommend upgrade. Also, I have added 4 GB ram which doesn't seem to be required at all. I did not see ram goes more than 10% when multiple processes are running. So, 2GB seems to be good enough.
customer_reviews.author: semo

customer_reviews.title: Making storage great again
customer_reviews.text: Yes you can build storage cheaper. But the Synology just works. And it's stupid simple. And still flexible. And it just works. Some projects are worth the time to build in a DIY fashion and get all nerdy. I don't feel that home storage is one of them and I was happy to be fully up and running from unboxing to production usage in about an hour. It's great. I'll never build another unraid or other home grown storage server again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Put in max memory, Added 2 NVMe SSD's to find out they weren't compatible. My own fault. Put in two larger ones that were compatible according to the website. The SSD's wouldn't show up. Was told to replace them. Had same issue's with 4 8TB drives. Replaced same issue. Went with 4TB drives same degrading issue's every time I turned around. So I can't say it's Western digital hardware bein all faulty. This thing is the Synology DS918+. It's slow and throws out errors like no ones business.
customer_reviews.author: Draxx

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work Terrible technical support
customer_reviews.text: DS218+ does not work. It comes without instructions. Essentially you are on your own to find contact numbers and instruction. I was a to find a telephone number on the internet. Called several times now answer. I got some instructions from internet to setup an account with Synology. After seral tries an spending a lot of time and was able to install Synology Assistant. The unit stopped working. After a while connected to the Synology technical support. They could not solve the problem. They wanted to give my credit card to replace the device. I am returning the device to Amazon. I do not want to deal with Synology ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: Unit Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked the unit, installed the hard drives, connected power and ethernet and hit the power button and got nothing. I live chatted with tech support and he told me to pull the hard drives an power it on. Really? Unplug the unit and try again? I never would have thought of that. I'm an engineer with 30 years experience electronics manufacture and there is no more basic quality control test than does the unit power on so I assume the have none. Anyway I still waiting for tech support to give me an RMA but I'm going to exchange through Amazon instead since they are not responding fast enough.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Synology's support is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with the initial backup, and Synology makes it practically impossible to get any clear support. There's no real-time option, and I think there might be a language barrier. Responses always came a couple days later at least, and usually did not address my initial concerns. A chat option would have been ideal, but as far as I can tell that's not something they offer. This device is not beginner friendly by any stretch.
customer_reviews.author: bigGIANTcircles

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money - wait for the next upgrade
customer_reviews.text: We’ve owned multiple synology products over the year - all up until this point have had high reliability and worked out of the box. I transferred our data to the new unit, but quickly noticed the device would shut down randomly, blue blinking and many times we’d be unable to find or connect to the box, without disconnecting the power and reconnecting. After reading multiple forum sites, it appears to be a faulty power supply - seems this is common with the new devices. I’ve since decided to return the unit, and keep our existing box - will try upgrading again on the next product update.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Should have gone with a Synology from the start...
customer_reviews.text: I switched to the Synology DS918+ after using a WD MyCloud EX2 for 4-5 years. Both products had a very good user interface and capabilities. I ran into some glitches about 3 years ago with the MyCloud which would cause iSCSI images to disappear off the machine during a power outage. The data was recoverable but it was very time consuming. WD failed to fix the glitch and when it happened a second time, I decided it was time to switch to Synology. Very pleased with the performance and ease of use. Some little things I really appreciate is the fan speed and LED brightness controls.
customer_reviews.author: Casey S

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great performance!
customer_reviews.text: My DS415+ died, and only 1 week past warranty.... Luckily i only had 2 drives in it so i purchased this beast, mush more powerful than my older model with expandable memory storage slot. Besides the host of features that come with DSM, and the apps you can download as well, i mainly use my NAS for Plex, and photostation (some vm's) this DS718+ sings locally and remotely for what i do, and setting the old drives into the new NAS, as easy as inserting the drives itself, all configurations and media were retained, couldn't ask for an easier migration! Definitely Reccomend! Hope this helps!~ -MrJ
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jurado

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a Zyxel first and it was junk. There is no comparison to this Synology NAS. The Synology performs flawlessly and has an endless array of tools and applications. I've also used Buffalo NAS's in the past, (junk). I will never use another NAS after experiencing this one. By FAR the best one out there. Don't fall for the "cheaper" NAS systems. They WILL NOT perform as expected. NOTE: I've worked in I.T. infrastructure for more than 30 years.....
customer_reviews.author: Rob R.

customer_reviews.title: HW failed after 3~4 months of super light use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to set up as NAS drive, worked fine initially, setup was relatively easy following clear instructions on Synology website, yet it was used to backup laptop drive and copy some important files to backup for an average of 2~3 times a month, after 3~4 months the unit just won't come on anymore, contact Amazon that referred me to Synology tech support, contacting Synology tech support was not an easy process, the worst is the feedback time (been 4 days without a feedback from Synology customer support), gives me the feeling you're purchasing an item with no expected support (renders expensive HW useless in my case)
customer_reviews.author: Yehia

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple and reliable NAS to backup file files. I could not understand why Synology was so much more money than other brands. I understand it now after buying this unit. It is built solid and is very quiet. The software does a lot more than just providing a storage service. Basically the device is a small computer in itself. You can install Apps etc. The interface is very clean and crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Novice storage made flawless
customer_reviews.text: When looking at Nas systems I went back and forth for months trying to decide which system I would do (if any at all). I kept waffling between Synology, a few cheaper options and even DIY offerings like FreeNas. I have to say I am so glad I decided to go with synology. The software they provide is well worth the premium price they charge for their NAS's. I recommend looking up instructions but I chose to go the manly route and just plug it in, get the drives in and figure it out as I go. I was quickly in the OS and setting up permissions without any hassle at all. I cannot recommend Synology enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Difficult setup for a home device
customer_reviews.text: Physical setup and installation is as easy as it could be. Pull the carriers out, attach the hard drives and slide them back in. Plug in a network cable and power supply and you are done. Network setup is a bear. Nothing is intuitive. Instructions for even basic setup are difficult to follow. Accidently hitting a wrong software switch can prohibit users from having access to folders. It got to the point I deregistered the drive, did a factory reset, deleted my Synology account and started over. I've been working on setup for two weeks and still don't have all the features I want to use set correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't get much better than Synology. It just works. Migration process from an older unit was fairly painless - the Synology help documentation was more confusing, requiring to use HyperBackup, but I just put the disks in the new unit and it fired up with little fanfare. I just needed to update some of the apps. Some wouldn't update and need to be uninstalled (likely because they were the wrong versions for this unit). Emby didn't come through, so all those settings had to be recreated. Is a lot faster than my 6 year old unit - well worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: 2GB RAM not enough. Get a 8GB DDR3 1866Mhz stick for optimum performance. (10GB total) Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine as my first synology to set up a small SoHo server with the intention of adding Active Directory to my network in addition to RADIUS server authentication for wireless clients, VPN access and a webserver for internal resources, (apache, MySQL, PHP).. as well as NAS storage of course, with RAID 1. Since this device comes only with 2GB of RAM I immediately added a single 8GB stick (the Crucial 8GB Single DDR3/DDR3L 1866 MT/s (PC3-14900)), for a total of 10GB of RAM. Works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Istvan

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!
customer_reviews.text: This storage solution is awesome! I was looking for a device to backup our family photos on, and paired with the DS Photo app, it automatically backs up every image I’ve taken ass soon as I get home. Super helpful! I love the easy raid configuration for redundancy. And I even use an additional SSD drive for hosting my own website. I love not having to pay iCloud or Dropbox every month for storage and more importantly, enjoy the peace of mind that comes from managing my own cloud. Thanks Synology for making a super user friendly UI and having lots of easy to follow tutorials online.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong w/Synology...solid tech from a solid company!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 918+ for my yacht & then realized it was way more powerful than I needed. Repurposed that one for my home where it is a Plex media server, backup server 4 our PC's, & general storage repository. Cloned the Plex media server to this new DS218+ and have been using it on my boat for 2 weeks now. 218 has been perfect size, runs off 12Vdc, sends streams to TV's in the staterooms or MP3's 2 Sonos speakers without any issues so far. Synology as a company has impressed me with their offerings & performance. This has been my first experience w/Synology & I'm very happy I choose them after looking at tons of NAS companies...
customer_reviews.author: Scott D.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but slow
customer_reviews.text: My rating has more to do with my overall experience rather than the quality of the merchandise. This appears to be well-built, I expect it to last. I am not a network guru so the documentation is over my head. I have fast 1GB internet, and I installed the best/fastest hard drives I could find, but this system is painfully slow. Uploading my photos takes forever. Retrieving files once uploaded is much faster, but still a frustrating lag. I don’t know if this is a true solution for me. I can see it being a great backup solution, but I’m unsure about the day to day.
customer_reviews.author: Jedwabne

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this NAS mostly as a Plex server and recording DVR for my HDHomeRun. I have to say it works fairly well. It was a little difficult at first for me to set up as I am not familiar with the OS but their is plenty of information on the web on how to use this and if you aren't familiar just take your time and do the research and you should be good to go. It uses low power and is virtually silent. I have run two simultaneous Plex streams without issues after upgrading to the maximum RAM capacity which is 6 GB. I am also using it as a backup for two PCs.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Wishbone

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: had it booted, everything working, went to boot it today and got a blinking blue LED. wont boot anymore. Going to send it back to Amazon, this is dumb. Update: After a month of letting it sit I got it to work. Synology is awesome. I really have no complaints. The whole thing works like a charm. Couldn't figure out why the device wasn't working at first, pulled out all the drives and reinserted them and the whole thing works.
customer_reviews.author: avocadopotamus

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself time and headaches. Find a different solution
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this unless you want unending headaches. I have had more login issues and forced updates with this thing than stable usage. The UI is clunky and unintuitive. If I could go back in time I would never buy this product again. I hope this can save people the countless hours of trying to figure why this device isn’t working again and again. Couldn’t be more disappointed. Cannot recommend buying synology products.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Keep Up
customer_reviews.text: This NAS couldn't keep up with my Plex media server. Constantly buffering live channels. Never had any buffering issues with my Linux server or Windows server. Contacted Synology for a solution and they were no help, blaming Plex for the issue when obviously it isn't when there are no buffering issues on my other servers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sita

customer_reviews.title: Faster replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had a four disk system from about six years ago. I was only using two disks so decided to get this unit instead. I was able to put my old drives in and the system booted without issue. I lost nothing. This system is easily 100% faster than my old one. Tool free drive sleds, easy memory upgrade, and you can dim or even turn off the front LEDs. Very happy with my purchase. Okay so the one downside: Its louder than my older one. I think the plastic case versus a metal one seems to just amplify the drive noise more.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great promise. No Manual. KB doesn't match reality. Support is pretty rough
customer_reviews.text: I've set up several backup systems over the years. It's not my full-time job, but I can read and follow instructions, troubleshoot, and fill in the gaps. This has been a trainwreck. There's no manual. The knowledgebase instructions don't match their apps (possibly because the KB instructions are for past versions) Support keeps referring back to KB articles that don't apply to the current versions of the software. Very sad, because it could be an incredible solution.
customer_reviews.author: ClimbOn

customer_reviews.title: A great NAS
customer_reviews.text: A little intimidating at first, YouTube videos helped a lot but it has been up and running for a month and is a great convenience. We run a small home based business and this has become an invaluable resource for keeping inventory and invoices that can be accessed by multiple devices. I put in two 4TB ironwolf drives and that gives us plenty of storage. We have it configured as a raid system so our data is protected. The GUI makes it easy to manage user accounts and system tasks. We chose this over other systems because of the GUI.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Love my Synology!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Synology disk station that I've owned over the years but the first four bay I've owned. I've always loved their DSM (software client) and ease of use. There's great tutorials and instructions online for securing your NAS and integrating it into your own home network. I primarily use mine for media storage but the applications with this NAS which also include PLEX streaming are plentiful. I'd highly recommend this NAS if you're looking for a decent mid-range household NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Aleks Pausak

customer_reviews.title: My first consumer NAS
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty technical, so this was fairly straightforward to set up. I put in two 8TB Seagate Ironwolf drives and set them up in a mirrored RAID configuration. Now I have a true backup solution for all of my media. In hindsight, I wish I would have spent a little more money for the DS918+ purely for the extra two drive bays for expansion and the dual GB NICs. It seemed reasonably quiet and would have been fine sitting on my desk, but I stuck it in my server room so noise is a non-issue anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Torkko

customer_reviews.title: I most say that I like the Synology 4 bay NAS DiskStation DS916+ better than ...
customer_reviews.text: I most say that I like the Synology 4 bay NAS DiskStation DS916+ better than the Synology 4 bay NAS DiskStation DS918+. They both setup with the same amount of ease, but the DS916+ is a faster unit. I have the same drives, the same amount of memory, same data, and same apps installed, but the DS916+ is faster. So far that is my only knock. They are very stable and easy to use. Great for novice or advanced user, home or small business. A very large selection of apps and configuration selection.
customer_reviews.author: jawspaws

customer_reviews.title: Synology forever!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Synology NAS and I love it. This unit is faster than my old DS416, probably 8 times faster and accept any DDR3 memory available in the market, don't spend you money on expensive DDR3 modules, buy regular modules like me and enjoy. I used 2 modules of 8Gb and I can run several Dockers and a VM without compromuse 50% of the memory. To improve the transcoding feature install the FFmpeg package available on 3rd party packages. Surveillance Station is working here with about 12 cameras, so in my case I had to team the network card in order to improve the data flow without compromise my local streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Sandry Seibert

customer_reviews.title: The Hyper Backup application does a nice job of interfacing with a Linux-based NAS
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing the DS218+, I had built my own NAS from parts and open source software. While my home-built system was adequate, it wasn't all that user-friendly. The DS218+ was a huge step up even though I'm not taking advantage of all the different applications that are available for it. I mostly use it as shared file storage and as the destination for backing up various computers on the LAN. I now use my home-built NAS as the destination for backing up the DS218+. The Hyper Backup application does a nice job of interfacing with a Linux-based NAS, while File Station and Cloud Station satisfy my file sharing needs.
customer_reviews.author: observing

customer_reviews.title: does a lot
customer_reviews.text: I only have a basic knowledge of networks and how they work and setup. i can fiddle with it and figure it out with google searches and such. I almost returned this though. for some reason a basic backup of specific folders on my PC took me forever to figure out. eventually contacting tech support and they directed me to some articles to read. Now it does what i want. my TVs see it. my computers see it. my tablet and phones see it. and the computers and phones backup to it. and i don't hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Dino P

customer_reviews.title: GOOD Company but BUY extended warranty, Synology support is consistently horrible.
customer_reviews.text: 2nd unit arrived and so far (3 days), no issues. The Good: Sturdy Construction, Secure, Quiet, Frequent updates, Good server utilities, Good performance, Network management experience not essential. The Bad: Will not do 4kUHD, transcoding & always limited to 1080p output under PLEX, The plastic case is a little thick so standard eSATA cables don’t lock into place. The Ugly: REPAIR of unit at Synology under "WARRANTY return shipping was $54" , SALES department has free return shipping. note: Spend the extra $7 for 4yr extended warranty that bypasses Synology hardware support and also provides free shipping
customer_reviews.author: boatbeat

customer_reviews.title: Great Plex server ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to upgrade from my old DS-214se. I wanted to use it as a Plex server and it works great. I have a collection of movies over 6 TB in mixed quality and over 4 TB in 4K content and this unit plays it all with no issues. I like the fact that you can upgrade the memory as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Business-grade performance at a consumer-grade price
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by this box. Synology for me had a reputation as a consumer-focused device, but I bought this for business-grade backup and it does not disappoint. The case is plastic, but that seems to be the only evidence of a consumer focus instead of business. Since this is sitting on a shelf in my data center, I don't really care if it's metal or plastic. Setup of RAID-5 array was easy. There is plenty of information on status of initializing the array. Firmware and Software update was easy as part of the setup process. Unit has been running perfectly for several months now without needing any attention - which is basically what you want out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Beaugrand

customer_reviews.title: A nice, unobtrusive NAS
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to say - it sits quietly in its corner of the room and does its job. Which is pretty much the best kind of review for a device like this. It has a lot of options; a user will want to spend a little time learning them. It is pretty easy to configure for me, but I know my way around computers. Someone with less experience might need help from a tech savvy friend. Or just keep your stuff on the cloud and let them handle it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Beyard

customer_reviews.title: Not for a HOME USER, as promoted. It would take an IT engineer to figure this out
customer_reviews.text: Poor support, reliance mainly on third-party videos, clunky interface that looks like Windows 3.1 from the 1990s. I am a Mac user, and not naive about computers, but this unit is IMPOSSIBLE. I had no idea how anything or even what was possible. Unless you're a computer geek, DO NOT GET THIS. IT IS NOT READY FOR PRIME TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Apple

customer_reviews.title: Fine for my basic use
customer_reviews.text: One odd quirk i have discovered is that it will only recognize my - ICY DOCK Tool-less 3.5" SATA III HDD USB 3.0 External RAID Drive Enclosure - ICYRaid Dual Bay MB662U3-2S R1 (also from Amazon) as as usb drive 1 or 2. It lets me rename any other usb hard drive. No biggie. This would only be an issue if it wouldn't let me rename any of the external hard drives i add, because then network drive mapping and backing up would become pita.
customer_reviews.author: DTM

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup with lots of apps to choose from
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to setup. Lots of options if needed but the out of the box settings work well until you figure out if you need to tweak anything. After some issues with dropping connections which ended up being user error it is rock solid. Getting help was easy and fast. Email to customer support was answered fast. Only small issue is how the browser page is formatted for a phone browser is a bit odd but still usable. The apps for the phone (android and ios) work pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: bigdave

customer_reviews.title: More than satisifed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Synology to replace the DS212j and WOW what a difference, I added 4GB's of RAM for a total of 6Gb's including the 2GB's that were pre-installed, the Diskstation Manager runs so much more quickly and efficiently now, it's almost a night and day difference. I highly recommend Synology for their products, they are very well designed and allow me to run Plex almost flawlessly now (built in hardware decoding on this unit). I also use this unit for my home security which utilizes Z-Wave and it works with USB pass through with no problem. Best purchase I have made in a while... I would easily recommend this to any of my friends/family.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Synology makes it harder than it should be,
customer_reviews.text: I bought this DS-218+ thinking that as it was a current model it would be easy to setup. Boy, was I wrong. All the programs needed to add a second drive wouldn't work for me. Tech support would tell me to do something and it would not work. So, now I am stuck with a one drive, two drive capabile unit. No redudancy.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Alley

customer_reviews.title: Synology is always the best
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Synology DS413j NAS and wanted to add this as the main media server/files server at home (to better support HD/4K TVs) and move the old NAS as a backup/DR purposes. Synology is always the best when it comes to user friendliness with their DSM OS. This has two Ethernet ports and they can be bound together for a 2Gbps line. My router supports 2 Ethernet port binding but according to what it says while setting this up; even if the router doesn't support Ethernet port binding Synology NAS would by itself do load balancing/failover if both ports are connected to the network. Running it for a week now and no complains.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Diskstation. I enjoyed the 1st one so much that when the hard drives started to fail 6 yrs later, I realized I had to replace it. What can I say, it's awesome. It can do so much more than my old DS212+. Purchased a pair of 3 TB Western Digital Green drives to replace the ones that were starting to go. Same kind of drives I had in the old DS. This is my personal cloud back up. It's also my media sever for streaming movies. There are so many things you can use it for and you can access it pretty easily from in and outside of your network.
customer_reviews.author: shiver

customer_reviews.title: Taking a wait and see approach!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, would give between 2 and 3 stars. Like the device but its been over a month and I still can't access from outside the home. Tech support has been abysmal. Maybe should have gone with Western Digital!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I have got this NAS for archive and media, paired it with two Seagate IronWolf 12TB and two Crucial 500GB ssd as cache. Reviewing this in an aspect of a few days used, the product is really quite (under my desk) and the interface is superb, especially if you look within their app store that has many features and cool stuff to play with. Also, product aims to guide every person with different kind of levels, which is super important, just hope my wife wont make changes, lol. Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: QuakerIT

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning it after a month and hours of messing with it. Had issues with mass changing of file creation dates, folder names mismatches between macOS and Win10 looking at same folder on NAS, folders disappearing, and folder deletion hassles where it kept stopping deletion becausion some random file was in use when it wasn’t. Got frustrated with all the system quirks and returned it. Replaced with a USB3.0 RAID 1 dual drive for my MacMini using the Minis server options. I find this much simpler and far cheaper with no quirks so far. Bottom line was I didn’t need a hobby just a Raid 1 file system with high speed usb 3 interface.
customer_reviews.author: C. Conkey

customer_reviews.title: Very nice appliance
customer_reviews.text: set it up with 4x2TB drives, in two groups, RAID1 each. so far everything has been working as designed. i have one of the volumes designated for TimeMachine backups of my macbook pro, the other handles just files. speeds are fine, noise level is very acceptable, although the appliance is located in the living room, so noise would not really be an issue. i was actually quite impressed with the software and all the different tools available like Music Station, iTunes server, Image Station and many many others that i have not yet tried. Will do and report back.
customer_reviews.author: AlK

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself some time — invest in Synology
customer_reviews.text: Was having lots of problems with time machine with my WD MyCloud, tried a WD EX for weeks with various command line hacks To mount the devices and format drives — finally gave in and bought this — 10 minutes and it’s set up for scheduled Image backups for Windows PC’s Ubuntu servers, and Mac Time Machine. The Synology tutorials on site are incredibly helpful, setup was genuinely enjoyable. Invest in this device, rather than wasting your time with lesser (almost) ‘NAS’ cloud based products. Also great that it’s scalable, and haven’t validated but seems that you can up this to 16gb DDR3 without issue. This is simply the supreme home backup, plex/media server.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a NAS
customer_reviews.text: Overall quite satisfied with the purchase. One less star because of the software - the one big issue I have is picture management. DS Photo (software recommended by Synology) for picture management is not very user friendly and not very convenient to use. Still searching for alternatives to DS Photo. Also running docker containers - works well and processor seems to handle whatever I throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: socoamz

customer_reviews.title: Very stable, very usable, flexible, upgradeable
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I'm an old (as in outdated) tech guy, so upgrading both RAM chips and getting share drives set up was not easy. Fortunately, there's a whole series of youtube videos laying out in simple detail how to do whatever you want to do with this NAS. And guess what... they work! I've had 0 problems with glitchy software, etc. Great capability.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: True plug and play
customer_reviews.text: This NAS was a replacement of an old NAS that failed on me a few months ago. Installation was a snap and fully automated. The software bundle is second to none, as is their customer support. My primary reason for having a NAS is having a back up storage for the entire household, which is pretty basic for this system. Synology offers a vast suite of software to do much more. I haven't played or even installed many of them yet, but it's nice to know they are available at no extra cost if and when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Crabman

customer_reviews.title: everything working good. CPU is powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about performance. But when I set it up, everything working good. CPU is powerful enough. I will keep testing on Plex. If it does a good job. I will come back to tell you guys. I don't know why data transfer via WiFi only gets 30MB per sec. so I drop two stars for poor performance. I use three 10TB HGST NAS drive with 256MB cache. so transfer speed shouldn't slow down.
customer_reviews.author: UltraLeader

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I've used Synology products previously and they were great. Now it's very buggy. For example, Time Machine backups continually fail, across multiple computers and you have to reboot the NAS to make it work. When you copy folders to NAS using its copy function, it appears to copy, giving no errors, but then it turns out it was unable to copy some of the files. This product is not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: Soc entrep

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade to my old wd nas. More software options and features
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an old nas which only really offered storage, dlna and backup features. I'm mainly using it for a plex server and hdhomerun dvr. It has many other uses that I still have yet to discover. Seems like a nice piece of hardware. I have since started taking advantage of its nvr features. I have purchased a set of ip cameras and a video doorbell to replace my ring products which I loved. There is a bit of a learning curve to get them working but being a bit of a techie I am muddling my way through it. I keep finding my uses besides being a media storage system.
customer_reviews.author: crash

customer_reviews.title: Trusted equipment, works awesome, totally worth the premium price.
customer_reviews.text: Basically an overpriced computer but its well worth it so its really not overpriced. The product over delivers by making NAS management a breeze. For the average user the UX will be your life blood and there isn't anything this polished while being basically a special purpose product with tool-less HDD trays. I use the shell, and chroot and it is so nice to have the advanced NAS features just work out of the box and then log in to do more complex work. I can't think of a more packaged easy to use server for the every-man-woman.
customer_reviews.author: Please Mark Darkly

customer_reviews.title: Works with Time Machine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Synology DS718+ with great expectation to use the NAS as a device to backup my two MacBookPro laptops. My initial backup failed, and I have since learned that you must set up a Time Machine User account for each laptop; Since then, it work has worked great. It is slow in for the initial backup; took me almost 3 days to backup 600 GB. I previously owned two Time Capsules and Apple has discontinued selling them. I like Synology option better, because it allows you to use the device for other services as well as backup.
customer_reviews.author: A Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good software and stable operating system
customer_reviews.text: I have used this DS218+ for several months, and it is a great addition to my home network. It comes ready with RAID in place for 2 drives, and setup was straightforward once I added the drives. I use it for storage of photos, videos, and movies. Additionally (and the best part so far), I installed the software for Plex, which now organizes and serves up all my photos, videos, and movies, and it also serves as my DVR along with an HD Homerun TV tuner. Now I have DVR capability and tons of storage in a compact, network device that I can place anywhere on my home network. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Common sense consumer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: After initially purchasing a similar TerraMaster unit and being completely unimpressed with the speed, operating system, and features I tried synology based on reviews and tech websites recommendations. I'm am quite happy with the resources and features offered with this synology unit. Very easy setup but a comprehensive supply of applications that make home computing a bit better. I'm more reassured withsynology over TerraMaster in respects to its security config and options. Probably in the top 5 tech buys this year
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Yendor

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast performance!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my new NAS. I started out with a single core DS212j, so this beast is blazing fast in comparison. I am only sad that I didn't upgrade sooner. I know it is hard for those that have a fully functioning value model to justify moving to something like this, but it is worth it!! I really didn't need the 4 bay model, but the caching option was what sold it for me. I'm so blown away right now by the performance, that I'm not even sure I need to add the cache drives. If you are on the fence about upgrading or buying your first synology, don't hesitate with this model. It is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: C. ToddTop Contributor: Soccer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this NAS
customer_reviews.text: This is a great NAS. This is my fourth Synology NAS and my second DS918+. I am very happy with both. They are stable, reliable and easy to configure and manage. There are dozens of features (packages) that you can add that significantly improve functionality out of the box. Nearly all are free. I wish I had more time to explore these additional features, but I really like: Disk Station, Media Server, Perl, Surveillance, and so many more.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Powell

customer_reviews.title: Won't work as a standalone PMS, but is great as a standard NAS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this NAS to double as a Plex Media Server (PMS). However the unit was not powerful enough to act as a proper PMS. I ended up also purchasing an Nvidia Shield to use as the actual PMS, and simply used the DS218+ as a standard linked NAS. With that configuration it works great. If I had it to do again, however, I would've purchased a less expensive Synology NAS and otherwise kept the configuration with the Nvidia Shield PMS.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mason

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my old DS411j to this DS918+. This NAS is awesome... soo much faster! Packed it with fourdrives and had it up on the network in less than an hour. Awesome. Out with the old, in with the new!
customer_reviews.author: Sub

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Fast, great software, intuitive and feature-rich
customer_reviews.text: In the words of an SNL character, it has everything: features, UI, speed, outside access and reliability. I had WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra for a few years before this, and, boy, what a difference! I put in two Toshiba 14TB 512e HDD drives and had no issue using it on the network, be it Windows systems or nVidia Shield TV - all work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vladyslav Hrybok

customer_reviews.title: Nice NAS, no power recovery, you have to be home and push the button!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice NAS and it is doing what I had wanted it to do. The only idiocy of the unit is, if you lose power or your UPS fails, you have to physically be at home to push the power button again to get it back on. I am sorry but that is just a ridiculously stupid design! I travel a lot and if this happens it is just another plastic brick on my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: 15camaro

customer_reviews.title: I love this box!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Synology DS918+ NAS. It's a Plex server. It's a Time Machine backup server for our Macs. It's a shared folder for our Windows machines. It's an encrypted file store with automated snapshot capability. It's an automated backup of our cloud storage (Google Drive and Dropbox) accounts. It's a Linux box with full ssh access. It does ALL the things.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good entry NAS but be sure to secure
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the DSM is easy to navigate. If you’re new to setting up a NAS I would suggest watching the YouTube video synology created to guide users on how to secure the unit from intruders. If you’re looking to run virtual machines then you’ll need more RAM, there’s 2 SODIMM slots and it comes preinstalled with a single 2GB stick. I replaced the preinstalled RAM with 2 Crucial 8GB 1600MT/s sticks and virtual machines run well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS
customer_reviews.text: I looked at reviews and this seemed the best for my purposes. I just wanted something for backup of the main drive on my PC (I am a semi-pro photographer and cannot afford to lose any of my images). It took a bit of online study to understand the software packages provided for backup (which one to use and how to set it up). Once setup the backup runs virtually instantly. The enclosure is well made and installation of the hard drives was very easy. It provides a great sense of security that I have redundancy in backup of my files.
customer_reviews.author: Otto V. Kruse

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but very powerful
customer_reviews.text: The Web GUI for the Synology is great. I'm a power user and found it very easy to do the initial setup yet still let me make some pretty in-depth customizations that I wanted. Despite the fact that you can now buy 14TB hard drives, the fact that this allows for an expansion unit to be attached is amazing. I feel very safe that I won't need to replace this anytime soon just because I run out of space.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hazelbaker

customer_reviews.title: 218+ can only handle 1 h265 encode at a time.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you install ffmpeg before you watch any h265 videos, otherwise your cpu will get stuck at 50% and you'll be forced to restart. Ui is decent and storage capacity is w/e you're willing to pay. I give it 5 stars because it was easy to set up but I take 3 stars because transcoding is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME!
customer_reviews.text: I have been running a Synology DS212J for 6 years as a backup/Plex storage server. I was running Plex media server on a Mac-mini and pointing the DS212J. Today it’s new religion! I now run Plex media server on the DS218+ and it’s awesome. What a difference 6 years makes as well as upgrading from an ARM to Intel. The migration was simple. I Just shutdown the DS212J moved over the hard drives to the DS218+ Turn it on and followed the wizard.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for movie servers
customer_reviews.text: Remote access via quick connect is amazingly simple. No more router configuring just type in a web address and it works. I can even stream my media to my family's smart TVs "which is not on my network btw" by downloading the DS Video app and casting it. I have zero complaints on this product I am extremely happy with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive little machine
customer_reviews.text: I had an aging WD My Cloud Mirror that had a degraded RAID volume. Aside from storing pictures and financial records, we used it as a DLNA server. I bought this and some Iron Wolf drives to replace it. Man, am I happy. The DS218+ is in another league as far as functionality goes. I even set it up to sync files with my office and home PCs so I can now cancel my Dropbox subscription. The apps Synology has are awesome. DLNA works much faster than on the WD My Cloud. And it really didn't cost that much more. There are tons of videos on how to set it up, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D.

customer_reviews.title: Love Synology
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade to my old DS212. The upgrade worked incredibly smoothly and the DS218+ has been running like a champ for several months now. I went with + model so that I could easily upgrade the RAM. My previous DS212 had just 256MB soldered to the board and I didn't want to be stuck without an upgrade option. That said, 2GB probably would have been sufficient for my usage (home backup, music server mostly), but I installed 4GB more for $20. I love the ease of use of the Synology web interface and just discovered I can play my music on my Echo with an Audio Station Alexa skill.
customer_reviews.author: D. Foster

customer_reviews.title: This was my second Synology NAS
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a DS212 several years ago to keep my wife's photos on. It ran seamlessly. I ordered this one to replace it so I can run Docker containers. Synology's DSM is easy to use. The hardware is reliable and the software is well maintained. I had not issue getting my drives out of the old unit and in to this one.
customer_reviews.author: coleopreacher

customer_reviews.title: Purchase relative to your need
customer_reviews.text: This unit is perfect for my application. Setup and maintenance is intuitive, lots of How-To videos on youtube and extremely quiet. I took away one star because my Samsung smart tv kept losing network connection with the unit, and that never happens with my universal media server on my mac. However, it seems to work best with a Roku using the Roku multimedia app. It's quick and feels good to navigate large amounts of media. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Boolean

customer_reviews.title: TimeMachine go-to
customer_reviews.text: I use mine for Time Machine backups and as a household video streaming server. Works great in both applications. Both my iPad (using VLC) and Oculus Quest have no trouble watching movies from it; Time Machine backs up quickly and smoothly, and configuring as a Time Machine host wasn't too complicated (it's not as smooth as Apple Time capsule usedta be, but eh.) One star off for shipping without one piece of the drive-mounting rails. Synology eventually got me a whole replacement drive tray.
customer_reviews.author: L. More

customer_reviews.title: Super useful, increased productivity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this NAS with two 3-Tb WD Red drives. I synch everything on my three different computers through the Synology Drive, and that means everything I work on is always available no matter which computer I use. I also store large media on there, and they are accessible anywhere in the world. The various apps that Synology provides are fine, but it's really Synology Drive which works for me. One issue is power outtages, which for the first few weeks pushed my NAS offline overnight several times. I added a small UPS which gives my NAS 7 minutes of power after an outtage, and since then, it's been online nonstop. Together, this set up is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Nitro

customer_reviews.title: Synology DS218 NAS
customer_reviews.text: This is a straight forward NAS... Use it in Raid 1 with WD 4TB red drives. The apps Synology provides are a bonus; I use several of them. Best to use this system with Chrome browser, no hiccups. NG with Firefox. For example, was not able to directly backup subfolders in Firefox but was able with Chrome. No noise at all with the WD drives.
customer_reviews.author: Grandfather42

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive NAS device and OS - loaded with tools and apps
customer_reviews.text: I've been using NAS devices for 10 years and this product is without exception the top of the line in the value category. Installed two 8TB Toshiba NAS N300 drives and the set up was just about automatic. Amazing OS and user interface. Tools, utilities and apps that have all worked flawlessly so far. The DS 218+ as packaged is so much more than network attached storage. Provides many network server functions and features. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: rydvy

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my home business and games.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Synology NAS. I save all my games there now and I suppose I won't have to worry about a disk failure again. One goes down the other takes it place (not sure how) and I just buy a replacement and slip it in. That big plastic plate on the front of it (see picture above) just snaps off and there are your two disks. You just pull them out. You do need to screw them into their holders but it is easy. All in all I am well pleased with this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: James Bass

customer_reviews.title: Super nice and simple NAS with lots of options
customer_reviews.text: The thing was up and running within minutes. I've had it going for months now without issue. Its quiet, but you can assign fan profiles anyhow. It's nice and small. Looks great. I've got it connected to the cloud and have my iPhone and Sony Android phone set to auto backup and sync photos to it. I also use it for the Camera station feature to collect all my IP camera recordings.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L. Mccawley

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away - It is a nightmare to setup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this NAS drive based on its rating and have paid the price since. I cannot get the drive up and running. As of now, I am using it as large paper weight on my desk. I should have stayed with Apple products. I tried to contact Synology customer service but there has been no response. I have spent hours, over multiple days, and cannot get the drive to function properly. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is a ripoff, I wanted 4K, you don't get 4K, most media will not get 1080P and some 720P, the kick in the balls is no DTS, DTS-HD, & AEC3 forget it. The price of an over-bloated brick. Don't even trust youtube to review this product, it is worst than qnap and that was bad, but at a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Rebelto Harrigan jr.

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions: Why didn't I get a bigger one & What took me so long to buy
customer_reviews.text: From unpacking, loading the disks and getting this up and functioning on my network took about 30 minutes - very simple. I will caveat my review in stating I have only had this for the weekend and am only using it for storage/archiving. I'm not streaming from the NAS or doing any encoding, etc (yet.) I'm just mad I didn't get a 4 bay unit! The setup was super simple, I had this out of the box and running on my network (and transferring files) within 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Ruby Built The Pyramids

customer_reviews.title: When their web site goes down like it did today you are in a hostage situation
customer_reviews.text: Right now I can't get QuickConnect to work to sync data using CloudShare Sync between two Synology devices that are right next to each other because their web site is down and I can't reset my password for the QuickConnect account. Why they made their web site the man in the middle I don't know, but this is a really poor design. I am waiting for their site to come back up and not hang when I try to change my password. Their site is also giving 504 errors. Who designed their web services, some monkey?
customer_reviews.author: The Reason

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Little Device
customer_reviews.text: I really like this NAS. It is extremely easy to set up. Now there is a curve on any NAS, you can't get around it. That said, the install is driven by software and it takes care of the messy details for new users. If you want to manually control every aspect of the NAS of course you can still do it. I'm a fan having owned another Synology NAS for several years. I would be lost without my sharable storage. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Brown

customer_reviews.title: BTRFS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall Synology has some great NAS boxes but where they really shine is the software. Consumers and professionals can both use this software and not feel limited or overwhelmed. Out of the box the L2TP VPN did not work on this specific model but Synology support fixed it. (not sure if its an issue with this model or just my unit) My favorite aspect of this NAS in particular is BTFRS support which allows file self healing and virtual machine manager
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: A very robust and stable NAS
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised with the capabilities and the easiness of use of the software. There are caveats, but it is by far the best NAS system I have used. Of course I have not used all, but this one based on Linux and the extended rights system works well for me. Great system guys. I wish I bought the 4 disk one instead of two, but this can be solved later with another purchase and using the tools provided to manage them both. :-) Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Drive4Fun

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall. But not the simplest to setup and slightly complicated to fine-tune
customer_reviews.text: Came to it after ASUStore (sold on eBay) hoping (reading praising reviews everywhere) that it will be way less complicated than the former NAS. Well, not by much, as I found out. But a good product otherwise. Definitely quieter. Arguably not better feature-set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe Garbage Hardware
customer_reviews.text: On my second 918 NAS. First one had a complete power failure (I'm hooked up to a nice APS, so not due to my power line). The second one I own has wiped out two hard drives in one month....so hardware run amock again. I was running Surv Station and file folders. Spent lots of money on camera licenses that are now worthless. Do not buy this until they fix their motherboard and power supply issues.
customer_reviews.author: chaw704352

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little NAS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this NAS for the physical features: expandability and NVMe support, but I've also been very happy with the software features. It runs Plex natively (with hardware acceleration if you have a Plex Pass) and also has some capabilities to directly share files with other users. I've had a few power failures and, while the unit had to be manually powered back on, it picked right back up without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Ward

customer_reviews.title: A MUST ! NAS is now part of my life !
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a solution to backup my files, my photos and videos. But also, a solution to host my wife's blog. I heard about a lot of diferent NAS but Synology is VERY GOOD. I have two HDD - 3 TB each Pictures are constantly uploaded thru the app on my cellphone. blog is well hosted (wordpress) and sharing files within my house is now easy. Synology can be a bit more expensive but it's worst it
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Fructus

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS
customer_reviews.text: This component is perfect for the small to medium sized home/business user. The hardware is solid and works fantastically well. It is easy to set up and there are all kinds of help videos/instructions for configuring the software for your needs. I am using it as a backup device and extra storage so I don't know about its other professed capabilities (web email client etc.) but it is working as advertised with no down time. Very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Illuminati

customer_reviews.title: Excellent NAS
customer_reviews.text: This drive worked great right out of box. I was replacing an older DS211 NAS, but re-using the new WD Red drives I had purchased when I thought they were the problem. They were not the problem, the DS211 was dying. When I moved the drives into the DS718, it recognized them immediately and setup was a breeze. So far (just a couple of months into this new one) the unit is working great. The noise is very low and the speed is tremendous compared to the older NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly
